abstract.text: An interface that represents a GPU pipeline configuration for running kernels in a compute pass.

inlineContent.text: protocol is an interface that represents a specific configuration for the GPU pipeline for a compute pass. Use a pipeline state instance to configure a compute pass by calling the
To create a pipeline state, call the appropriate

). You typically make pipeline state instances at a noncritical time, like when your app first launches. This is because graphics drivers may need time to evaluate and build each pipeline state. However, you can quickly use and reuse each pipeline state throughout your app’s lifetime.

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An interface for dispatching commands to encode in a compute pass.
Configures the compute encoder with a pipeline state instance for subsequent kernel calls.
An instance describing the desired GPU state for a kernel call in a compute pass.
An interface that represents a GPU pipeline configuration for running kernels in a compute pass.
The device instance that created the pipeline state.
Creates a function handle for a visible function.
An unique identifier that represents the pipeline state, which you can add to an argument buffer.
Returns the length of reserved memory for an imageblock of a given size.
A string that helps you identify the compute pipeline state during debugging.
Creates a new pipeline state object with additional callable functions.
Creates a new intersection function table.
Creates a new visible function table.
The maximum number of threads in a threadgroup that you can dispatch to the pipeline.
The current state of shader validation for the pipeline.
The length, in bytes, of statically allocated threadgroup memory.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the compute pipeline supports indirect command buffers.
The number of threads that the GPU executes simultaneously.
The main Metal interface to a GPU that apps use to draw graphics and run computations in parallel.
The mutability options for a buffer that a render or compute pipeline uses.
An array of pipeline buffer descriptors.
Options that determine how Metal prepares the pipeline.
A description of the input and output data of a function.
Calculate the optimum sizes for threadgroups and grids when dispatching compute-processing workloads.
Optimize your app’s performance by grouping your resources into argument buffers.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Improving CPU Performance by Using Argument Buffers

abstract.text: Create pipeline states for render and compute passes, samplers, depth and stencil states, and indirect command buffers.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
